tit.cmt: 用語集の登録語句を採用しました。(the を追加しました。）
tit.e: Ishin no Sanketsu (The Three contributors of the Meiji Restoration)

sen.j: 維新の三傑（いしんのさんけつ）とは、倒幕・維新に尽力した木戸孝允と西郷隆盛と大久保利通のこと。
sen.e: Ishin no Sanketsu are Takayoshi KIDO, Takamori SAIGO, and Toshimichi OKUBO who made efforts to overthrow the Shogunate and realize the Meiji Restoration.
Ishin no Sanketsu are Takayoshi KIDO, Takamori SAIGO, and Toshimichi OKUBO who made efforts to overthrow the Shogunate and contributed to the Meiji Restoration.
Ishin no Sanketsu are Takayoshi KIDO, Takamori SAIGO, and Toshimichi OKUBO who made efforts to overthrow the Shogunate and contributed to the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 明治新政府内では、明治元年（1868年）、総裁局顧問専任として政体書を建言し「官吏公選」や参議内閣制など新政府と新国家の骨格作りに尽力し続けた木戸孝允が実質的な初代宰相に相当し、留守政府を預かって四民平等など残されていた諸施策を断行した西郷隆盛が第二代宰相に相当し、明治六年政変以後ビスマルク然と君臨し始めた大久保利通が実質的な第三代宰相に相当する。
sen.e: Of the New Meiji Government, Takayoshi KIDO is regarded as the virtual first saisho (prime minister) who proposed the Constitution of 1868 as a full-time advisor to the General Bureau in 1868 and contributed in structuring the frame of the new government and the new nation through "kanri kosen (public election of government officials)", sangi naikaku sei (councilor cabinet system), and the like, the second being Takamori SAIGO who carried out then remaining various policies like shimin byodo (equality of all people) managing the absent government, and the third virtually being Toshimichi OKUBO who began to reign as if Otto von Bismarck after the Meiji roku-nen no Seihen (the political change of 1873, starting from disputes over Seikan ron (the conquest of Korea)).

Of the New Meiji Government, there were three virtual saisho (prime minister), Takayoshi KIDO proposed the Constitution of 1868 as a full-time advisor to the General Bureau in 1868 and contributed to structuring the frame of the new government and state system through "kanri kosen (public election of government officials)", sangi naikaku sei (councilor cabinet system), Takamori SAIGO led the government and carried out remaining various policies such as shimin byodo (equality of all people) while some of highest ranks of governments were away on inspection trip to America and Europe (Iwakura Mission), Toshimichi OKUBO began to reign as if Otto von Bismarck after the Meiji roku-nen no Seihen (the political change in 1873, starting from disputes over Seikanron (debate on subjugation of Korea)).
sen.cmt: ※全体的に変更しました。特に「留守政府」the absent governmentでは何のことかよくわからないため、説明とIwakura missionという用語を付け足しました。※明治六年の政変 用語集に登録がありましたが、登録例よりもtrans1の翻訳の方がわかりやすいため、trans1の翻訳を残しました。「征韓論」の（）内説明等については変更しました。※「新国家」new nationとすると完全に新しい国を創り上げるような響きが含まれるため、「新国家の骨格」という意味でnew state systemと改めました。
sen.e: Of the New Meiji Government, there were three virtual saisho (prime minister), Takayoshi KIDO proposed the Constitution of 1868 as a full-time advisor to the General Bureau in 1868 and contributed to structuring the frame of the new government and state system through "kanri kosen (public election of government officials)", sangi naikaku sei (councilor cabinet system), Takamori SAIGO led the government and carried out remaining various policies such as shimin byodo (equality of all people) while some of highest ranks of governments were away on inspection trip to America and Europe (Iwakura Mission), Toshimichi OKUBO began to reign as if Otto von Bismarck after the Meiji roku-nen no Seihen (the political change in 1873, starting from disputes over Seikanron (debate on subjugation of Korea)).

sen.j: 木戸孝允の命日が1877年5月26日、西郷隆盛の命日が1877年9月24日、大久保利通の命日が1878年5月14日であり、実質的な宰相になった順番で、時期を同じくして死去している。
sen.e: Takayoshi KIDO's anniversary of the death is May 26,1877, Takamori SAIGO's September 24,1877, and Toshimichi OKUBO's May 14, 1878, as in order of when they became saisho, and they died almost around the same time.

sen.cmt: 原文が「実質的な宰相」という表現であるため、saishoの前にvirtualを追加しました。

sen.j: 徳富蘇峰の大作「近世日本国民史」最終巻『明治時代』時事通信社、のち「明治三傑」講談社学術文庫、1981年がある。
sen.e: In "Meiji jidai (Meiji Era)", the last book of the "Kinsei Nippon kokumin shi (history of the modern Japanese nation)" published by Jiji Press, one of the great works of Soho TOKUTOMI, there is a part in which he treated the three characters, and the part was published later in the title of "Meiji Sanketsu (the three distinguished of Meiji)" from Academic paperback library by Kodansha 1981.
sen.cmt: 維新の三傑-Wikipedia参照、補足しました。徳富蘇峰が生涯をかけた大著「近世日本国民史」最終巻に、三者を論じた『明治三傑』（講談社学術文庫、1981年、元版は第100巻『近世日本国民史 明治時代』時事通信社）があります。
sen.e: The three contributors of the Meiji Restoration are described in "Meiji jidai (Meiji Period)", the last book (Vol. 100) of the "Kinsei Nippon Kokumin shi (history of the Japanese People in Modern Times,)" one of the great works of Soho TOKUTOMI, originally published by Jiji Press and the part was published later in the title of "Meiji Sanketsu" from Academic paperback library by Kodansha 1981.
